sen.j: 大田南5号古墳（おおたみなみ5ごうこふん）は、京都府京丹後市（旧弥栄町と旧峰山町にまたがって）に所在する古墳時代中期前半の方墳である。
sen.e: Located inTango City of Kyoto Prefecture (straddling former Yasaka Cho and former Mineyama Cho), Otaminami Gogo-kofun (No.5 kofun) Tumulus is a rectangular tumulus built in the first half term of the middle Kofun period.

Located in Tango City of Kyoto Prefecture (straddling former Yasaka Cho and former Mineyama Cho), Otaminami Gogo-kofun (No.5 kofun) Tumulus is a rectangular tumulus built in the first half term of the middle Kofun period.

Otaminami Gogo-kofun (No.5 kofun) Tumulus is a rectangular tumulus built in the first half term of the middle Kofun period, located in Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture (straddling former Yasaka Town and former Mineyama Town).

sen.j: この古墳は、京都府北部の丹後半島の中央部にあり、標高82メートルの山の上に築かれた4世紀の後半に築造されたとものとみられている。
sen.e: Located at the center of Tango-hanto Peninsula, it is considered to have been built on a hill of eighty-two meters above sea level in the last half of the fourth century
Located at the center of the Tango-hanto Peninsula, it is considered to have been built on a hill of eighty-two meters above sea level in the last half of the fourth century
Located at the center of the Tango-hanto Peninsula, it is considered to have been built on a hill of 82 meters above sea level in the last half of the fourth century.
sen.cmt: 2ケタの数字をアラビア文字にしました。

sen.j: 近くに神明山古墳（日本海最大の前方後円墳）がある。
sen.e: Close to it lies Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus (the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus on the Sea of Japan side).
Close to it lies the Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus (the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus on the Sea of Japan side).
Close to it lies the Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus (the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus on the Sea of Japan side).
A rectangular tomb that is twelve meters wide and nineteen meters long
The rectangular tomb is twelve meters wide and nineteen meters long
The rectangular tomb is 12 meters wide and 19 meters long.
sen.cmt: 2ケタの数字をアラビア文字にしました。

sen.e: Assembled stone coffin
Assembled stone coffin
Assembled stone coffin

sen.j: 棺内に鏡と鉄刀1本が収められていた。
sen.e: A mirror and an iron sword were placed in the coffin.
A mirror and an iron sword were placed in the coffin.
A mirror and an iron sword were placed in the coffin.

sen.j: 鏡は、被葬者の頭部右上付近にあった。
sen.e: The mirror was placed to the upper right of the head of the deceased.
The mirror was placed near the upper right of the head of the deceased.
The mirror was placed near the upper right of the head of the deceased.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: 鏡は方格規矩四神鏡で、「青龍三年」（魏の明帝の年号で235年）の銘がはっている。
sen.e: The mirror is 'Mirror with TLV Pattern and Four Sacred Animals Design' with an inscription, 'Seiryu Sannen'(青龍三年) (third year of Seiryu, or 235 AD) (Seiryu, or Qinglong is the name of the era of Emperor Ming of Wei Dynasty of China).

The mirror is a 'Mirror with an TLV Pattern and a Four Sacred Animal Design' with an inscription, 'Seiryu Sannen'(青龍三年) (third year of Seiryu, or 235 AD) (Seiryu, or Qinglong is the name of the era of Emperor Ming of Wei Dynasty of China).

The mirror is a Mirror with an TLV Pattern and a Four Sacred Animal Design with an inscription, 'Seiryu Sannen' (third year of Seiryu, or 235) (Seiryu, or Qinglong is the name of the era of the Emperor Ming of Wei Dynasty of China).
sen.cmt: 半角にしました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: これまでは山梨県市川三郷町の鳥居原狐塚古墳出土の紀年銘鏡「赤烏元年」（呉の大帝の年号で238年）が最も古かった。
sen.e: Before this mirror was discovered, the oldest ancient mirror had been the mirror with year inscription 'Sekiu Gannen' (赤烏元年) (first year of Sekiu, or 238 AD) (Sekiu, or Chiwu is the name of the era of Emperor Da Di of Wu Dynasty of China) which was excavated from Toriibara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus in Ichikawa Misato Cho of Yamanashi Prefecture.

Before this mirror was discovered, the oldest ancient mirror had been the mirror with the year inscribed as 'Sekiu Gannen' (赤烏元年) (first year of Sekiu, or 238 AD) (Sekiu, or Chiwu is the name of the era of Emperor Da Di of Wu Dynasty of China) which was excavated from Toriibara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus in Ichikawa Misato Cho of Yamanashi Prefecture.

Before this mirror was discovered, the oldest ancient mirror had been the mirror with the year inscribed as 'Sekiu Gannen' (first year of Sekiu, or 238) (Sekiu, or Chiwu is the name of the era of the Emperor Da Di of Wu Dynasty of China) which was excavated from Toriibara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus in Ichikawa Misato Town in Yamanashi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.e: About a dozen teeth of the deceased
About a dozen teeth of the deceased
